intro: Artia, commonly known as the false heather, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or heathland environments. Artia has needle-like leaves that are densely packed, giving it a dense, mat-like appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
